alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Peoria; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 4:58PM CDT until April 20 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MARSHALL...WOODFORD...NORTHERN TAZEWELL AND SOUTHEASTERN PEORIA COUNTIES... At 458 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Bay View Gardens to near Glasford, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Metamora, Germantown Hills, Spring Bay and Bay View Gardens around 505 PM CDT. Bartonville, Marquette Heights, Bellevue and Washburn around 515 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Creve Coeur, West Peoria, East Peoria, Morton, Washington, Toluca, Deer Creek, Eureka, Roanoke, Secor and Minonk. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 25 and 31. Interstate 39 between mile markers 13 and 35. Interstate 474 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 74 between mile markers 87 and 117. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
